div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 140 Cephallenia, 1935 (229) Burial: c. 300-275 B.C. (T) Contents: 2+ AV, c. 350-400 AR Taras: AV st. (2 as Ravel 23 said to be almost fdc) Thurium: dist. (incl. Noe F, H, K2, L4 and N4; 2 of the last reported as very fine) Velia: st. (1 as BMC 59) Dyrrhachium: st.; dr. Corcyra: st. Chalcis: dr. (1 as BMC 41-3) Aegina: st. (1 as BMC 191) Pegasi of Corinth (many with A-P), Dyrrhachium, Ambracia, Corcyra, Anactorium, Leucas, Thyrrheium Disposition: Athens 50 (Dyrrhachium 3, Pegasi of Corinth 27, of Dyrrhachium 1, Corcyra 2, Anactorium 1, Leucas 14, Thyrrheium 2) ; London 12 (Thurium 1 as Noe L4, Dyrrhachium 6 st. and 1 dr., Corcyra 4 st.); Lockett 5 (SNG 499, 1668-71); Vlasto 1 (Ravel 23); de Nanteuil 1 (as Ravel 23) AA 1936, pp. 120-1 (list of Athens acquisitions) Letters from various correspondents in ANS, one mentioning 350+ Pegasi in the original hd.
